intro: Didymopelta turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan rock-cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering stems that bear small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually linear to oblanceolate, with a rough or hairy texture. Didymopelta turkestanica is adapted to survive in nutrient-poor soils and can withstand periods of drought.
